channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Anthropic’s new Claude ‘constitution’: be helpful and honest, and don’t destroy humanity
item.description: Anthropic is overhauling Claude's so-called "soul doc." The new missive is a 57-page document titled "Claude's Constitution," which details "Anthropic's intentions for the model's values and behavior," aimed not at outside readers but the model itself. The document is designed to spell out Claude's "ethical character" and "core identity," including how it should balance conflicting […]...

item.title: Irony alert: Hallucinated citations found in papers from NeurIPS, the prestigious AI conference
item.description: Research from startup GPTZero points to the impossible problem prestigious conferences face in the age of AI slop.

item.title: Engineer at Elon Musk’s xAI Departs After Spilling the Beans in Podcast Interview
item.description: Interesting timing.

item.title: Apple is turning Siri into an AI bot that’s more like ChatGPT
item.description: Apple is planning a big Siri overhaul that will transform the voice assistant into an AI chatbot built directly into its iPhone and Mac, according to Bloomberg reporter Mark Gurman. The update is reportedly coming later this year and will replace the existing Siri interface, allowing users to interact with the assistant by both typing […]

item.title: La Cour fédérale annule l’ordonnance de fermeture de TikTok Canada
item.description: La Cour fédérale a annulé mercredi une ordonnance du gouvernement exigeant que TikTok cesse ses activités au Canada. Cette décision signifie que le géant des médias sociaux peut continuer à exploiter ses bureaux au pays pendant que le gouvernement fédéral procède à un nouvel examen.

item.title: If You’re Not Watching ‘Frieren,’ You’re Missing Out on the Best Fantasy Anime in Ages
item.description: The second season of 'Frieren: Beyond Journey's End' is poised to be a quintessential must-watch anime in 2026.

item.title: Hidden Roku streaming stick feature gets you a free add-on to help improve connectivity and performance
item.description: Roku streaming stick users can claim a free HDMI extender. Here's how.

item.title: Most people now can't separate AI videos from reality, new Runway study reveals – not even its co-founder
item.description: Runway's latest AI video generator model shows that you may as well flip a coin when deciding if something is AI.

item.title: What is human-centric design and why does it matter?
item.description: Often dismissed as a ‘soft’ discipline, it’s actually the most practical route to value creation We have a growing problem making our institutions work for humans. Across society, and especially in business, humans are increasingly treated as resources to be squeezed rather than as individuals to be served. Employees become “human capital” to be optimized; customers become “users” to be converted or upsold. This tendency predates AI, but AI threatens to accelerate it dramatically—automating the depersonalization, scaling the indifference, and introducing another layer of abstraction that sepa...

item.title: 2026 Sundance Film Festival: Everything you need to know
item.description: The festival runs from Thursday, Jan. 22 through Sunday, Feb. 1. The 42nd Sundance Film Festival kicks off this week in Park City, Utah. It will be the last edition in its longtime home and the first without its founder Robert Redford, who died in September at age 89.

item.title: AI romance is not a bug
item.description: It’s Big Tech’s most dangerous feature. OpenAI, Meta, and Elon Musk’s xAI are not accidentally drifting into romance and sex. They are deliberately inviting it.

item.title: American Pediatricians Say You’re Thinking Way Too Much About Screen Time Limits
item.description: Good news: There are other things to worry about.

item.title: How the late Valentino Garavani mastered the art of the brand color
item.description: Valentino Rosso never became an official Pantone color, but it did become a part of fashion canon. Close your eyes and picture the word “Valentino.” Chances are, you’re seeing a very specific shade of red. This visual imprint is part of the creative legacy left behind by the Italian fashion designer Valentino Garavani, who died at home on January 19 at the age of 93. ...

item.title: 50,000 WordPress site affected in major plugin security flaw - here's how to stay safe
item.description: A popular WordPress plugin has a worrying flaw which could allow website takeover.

item.title: The story behind Macron’s expensive sunglasses
item.description: Emmanuel Macron just found his Davos meme moment thanks to a pair of $770 sunnies. The day after French President Emmanuel Macron wore a pair of Henry Jullien Pacific S 01 aviator sunglasses during his speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, the world wanted to know more about his eyewear.

item.title: Trump administration drops appeal over anti-DEI funding threat to schools and colleges
item.description: The dispute centered on federal guidance telling schools and colleges they would lose federal money if they kept a wide range of DEI practices. The Trump administration is dropping its appeal of a federal court ruling that blocked a campaign against diversity, equity, and inclusion threatening federal funding to the nation’s schools and colleges.

item.title: Microsoft ports the Xbox app to Arm-based Windows PCs
item.description: Microsoft has announced that the Xbox app is now available on all Arm-based Windows 11 PCs. The app's release follows an update Microsoft made to its Prism emulator in December 2025, which translates x86 and x64 apps to Arm, and now includes support for AVX and AVX2. Both extensions play a role in making games run efficiently on Windows.Windows on Arm users will be able to use the Xbox app to purchase, download and stream PC games, and Microsoft says that "more than 85 percent of the Game Pass catalog" now runs on Arm PCs. Unlike Valve's SteamOS, Windows on Arm also supports anti-cheat softwar...

item.title: $100 Off Shark Promo Code | This January
item.description: Shark makes some seriously powerful vacuums, from handheld vacs to steam mops. Don’t miss $100 off, 10% off, and more limited-time coupons from WIRED.

item.title: What We Know About the Winter Storm About to Hit the US—and What We Don’t
item.description: A huge portion of the United States is going to be hit with snow or freezing rain this weekend. Exactly where, what, and how much remains uncertain.

item.title: Your Takeout Meal Might Be Packing More Salt Than Advertised
item.description: A new study finds nearly half of labeled takeout meals contain more salt than what the menu claims.

item.title: ‘Fallout’ Just Dropped a Very Intriguing Bombshell
item.description: Episode 6 of the Amazon adaptation's sophomore season points to the arrival of another major faction from the games, with the help of Easter eggs within Easter eggs.

item.title: The US and China Are Collaborating More Closely on AI Than You Think
item.description: WIRED analyzed more than 5,000 papers from NeurIPS using OpenAI’s Codex to understand the areas where the US and China actually work together on AI research.

item.title: Hardware phone keyboards are a fad built on iPhone keyboard frustration — and it might not last
item.description: From Clicks Communicator to Titan 2 Elite, the gadget world is crying out for physical keyboards on their phones, but why?

item.title: Le télescope James-Webb observe une galaxie qui ressemble à la nôtre et qui n’aurait pas dû exister si tôt !
item.description: Armés d’instruments de plus en plus performants, les astronomes repoussent de plus en plus loin les limites de notre Univers. Ou plus exactement de ce que nous connaissons de l'Univers. Le télescope spatial James-Webb a révélé de nombreuses galaxies très anciennes. Parmi elles, une galaxie qui...

item.title: EDF Tempo : une avalanche de jours rouges arrivent
item.description: Avis aux abonnés à l’option Tempo : une avalanche de jours rouges se profile à l’horizon. Plus d’une quinzaine de jours n’ont pas encore été déclenchés depuis le début de la saison hivernale. Les prochaines semaines s’annoncent donc à haut risque. Mieux vaut s’y préparer.

item.title: « Ubisoft tel qu’on le connait n’existe plus » : 6 jeux annulés, studios fermés, restructuration – Ubisoft fait son grand reboot
item.description: C'est le grand chamboulement pour Ubisoft. La firme annonce une immense restructuration. Plusieurs jeux sont annulés, des studios ferment et les employés n'auront plus le droit au télétravail.

item.title: Annulations et reports de jeux, fermetures de studio, réorganisation : l’électrochoc Ubisoft
item.description: Ubisoft, le géant français du jeu vidéo, opère une réorganisation majeure et s'apprête à vivre quelques mois difficiles, entre fermetures de studios, reports et annulations de jeux. Une transformation en profondeur nécessaire, selon la direction, pour « reprendre son leadership créatif » et provoquer un rebond.

item.title: Meta is expanding Threads ads to all users globally
item.description: Threads has grown enough for Meta to fully integrate it into its advertising machine. On Wednesday, the company said that, with the platform now hosting 400 million monthly active users, ads are expanding globally to all users. The inevitable move follows a test in 30 countries early last year.Ads on Threads are powered by Meta's AI-powered advertising system. They'll use the "same level of personalization" (i.e., tracking and profiling) as Facebook and Instagram. Image, video and carousel ad formats will all appear natively in Threads feeds.Meta said the ad expansion will begin next week, but...

item.title: Blue Origin’s satellite internet network TeraWave will move data at 6 Tbps
item.description: The network will be designed for enterprise, data center, and government customers and could offer an alternative to SpaceX's Starlink service.
